qa_pairs.question: Where does Ericka Osorio currently live?
qa_pairs.answer: I currently live in the Diamond Heights area.
qa_pairs.source_text: uh my name is Eric alsorio I currently live in the Diamond Heights area

qa_pairs.question: What is Ericka Osorio's current occupation?
qa_pairs.answer: I am a part-time school bus driver.
qa_pairs.source_text: and uh what do you do for work right now I am a part-time school bus driver

qa_pairs.question: How did Ericka Osorio secure her current housing?
qa_pairs.answer: Since I already lived in that housing area, basically I got first picked because I was already living in the housing.
qa_pairs.source_text: so since I lived with my mother when they opened the wait list I applied so since I already lived in that housing area basically I got first picked because I was already living in the housing

qa_pairs.question: Who lives with Ericka Osorio?
qa_pairs.answer: Just my daughter and then my grandmother.
qa_pairs.source_text: and who lives with you now just my daughter and then my grandmother

qa_pairs.question: Why does Ericka Osorio's grandmother stay with her?
qa_pairs.answer: I do help take care of her but she does have her own place but just because she's elderly, I try to help her.
qa_pairs.source_text: and why does your grandmother stay with you um I do help take care of her but she does have her own place but just because shes elderly um might try to help her

qa_pairs.question: What challenges do Ericka Osorio's loved ones face regarding housing?
qa_pairs.answer: There's not enough programs to help and there's not enough wait lists. I have family members who live with friends because there's not enough help.
qa_pairs.source_text: I could say that it has affected my loved ones because um theres not enough programs to help and theres not enough wait lists I would say because I do have family members who do live with friends because theres no theres not theres not enough help

qa_pairs.question: Why do people leave San Francisco or live with others, according to Ericka Osorio?
qa_pairs.answer: People leave San Francisco because it's expensive, but live with other people because there's just not enough help or if it's too expensive.
qa_pairs.source_text: you noticed people that had to either leave San Francisco or like you said live with one another yes because theres no help well people leave San Francisco because of their choice oh its expensive first but live with other people because theres just not enough help or if its too expensive

qa_pairs.question: Where do some school bus drivers move due to affordability issues?
qa_pairs.answer: A lot of them live in places like Fairfield and Antioch.
qa_pairs.source_text: do you know like the people that leave this video do you know their professions like are there other school bus drivers that cant afford to live in San Francisco and you know where in the Bay Area did they have to move to a lot of them do live in like Fairfield Antioch bus drivers

qa_pairs.question: What impact did the pandemic have on housing in Ericka Osorio's community?
qa_pairs.answer: The pandemic did a lot because they turned the gym at Horseman into housing for people who attended that school, impacting the community.
qa_pairs.source_text: well I would say like before the pandemic to it the pandemic did a lot because um I dont know if you guys know but um Horseman you guys are a horse man so you know a lot of people in that area well that went to that school thats they basically turned that gym into housing for people who all kids that attended that school so um an impact that Community a lot too

qa_pairs.question: What are Ericka Osorio's views on the future of the housing crisis?
qa_pairs.answer: I personally think the housing crisis will probably get worse as the years go on. I'm not even sure if we'll even be here in San Francisco, it's just too expensive.
qa_pairs.source_text: I personally think the housing crisis will probably get worse as the years go on Im not even sure if well even be here in San Francisco um its just too expensive out here

qa_pairs.question: What amenities does Ericka Osorio wish for her grandmother to have?
qa_pairs.answer: I would like for her to have a community center for elderly people, her own washer and dryer in her unit, and somewhere for her to walk.
qa_pairs.source_text: for her to stay on her own I would like for her to have like a community center for elderly people in her community that she lives in I would love for her to have her own washer and dryer in her own unit not in like you know for her somewhere for her to walk because I feel like her carrying all that back and forth is she might fall

qa_pairs.question: What resources does Ericka Osorio mention are available in the Mission area?
qa_pairs.answer: There's a lot of Resource Centers, schools, and bus stops on Mission Street.
qa_pairs.source_text: I would say the mission even though its not the best but they have most of the bus stops on Mission Street theres a lot of Resource Centers over there um it might not be like right on Mission Street but they have a lot of resources over there theres a lot of schools off of Mission Street

qa_pairs.question: What are Ericka Osorio's thoughts on new housing developments in downtown San Francisco?
qa_pairs.answer: I feel like when they build downtown, they're making it so expensive for people to not be able to afford or they're aiming for the richer people.
qa_pairs.source_text: just any like I mean downtown they are building some but I feel like when they build downtown theyre making it so expensive for people to not be able to afford or theyre aiming for the Richer people

qa_pairs.question: What does Ericka Osorio think about the availability of resources for special needs in different areas?
qa_pairs.answer: I would say all of them because I know a lot of the so I do normally drop off more towards the Avenues the sunset area um say more over there has more for special needs.
qa_pairs.source_text: and what areas of the city do you notice have better resource for special needs um I would say all of them because I know a lot of the so I do normally drop off more towards the Avenues the sunset area um say more over there has more for special needs

qa_pairs.question: What are Ericka Osorio's hopes for her daughter's future in San Francisco?
qa_pairs.answer: I would like Miley to stay in San Francisco, but I don't know if it will be possible depending on how the payment standard will be when she gets older.
qa_pairs.source_text: I would like Miley to stay in San Francisco um I dont know if it will be possible depending on how the payment standard will be when she gets older

qa_pairs.question: What events does Ericka Osorio enjoy in San Francisco?
qa_pairs.answer: Carnival for sure, and 420 even though I don't smoke personally, but it brings out different vendors for people.
qa_pairs.source_text: Carnival for sure um I would say 420 but I dont smoke personally but I feel like you know it brings out event different vendors for people

qa_pairs.question: What does Ericka Osorio think about the treatment of elderly people in the community?
qa_pairs.answer: I think because they're elderly, they probably give them like a push to the side, like 'oh you can go sit with your family' or whatever, but some of them may not have family here.
qa_pairs.source_text: I want to say elderly people I think because theyre elderly they probably give them like a push to the side like oh you can go sit with your family or whatever but you know some of them may not have family here

qa_pairs.question: What is Ericka Osorio's vision of a thriving community?
qa_pairs.answer: A thriving community is everybody in the community working together, coming together, and keeping your community safe.
qa_pairs.source_text: a thriving Community is everybody in the community working together coming together and keeping your community safe

qa_pairs.question: What are Ericka Osorio's hopes for the future of housing in San Francisco?
qa_pairs.answer: I hope that they can build enough housing for everybody, and that they can get it together even with the homeless people.
qa_pairs.source_text: my hopes for the future for housing is um I hope that they can build enough housing for everybody um in my hopes for San Francisco as a whole is that they can get it together even with the homeless people

qa_pairs.question: Why does Ericka Osorio believe there is a housing crisis?
qa_pairs.answer: I think that just from being working in the inside, there was a shortfall. There were too many housing vouchers given out and not enough like it was too much money dished out.
qa_pairs.source_text: why do you think there is a housing crisis right now I think that just from being working in the inside um there was a shortfall so working for the Housing Authority there was a a shortfall so I feel like there was too many housing vouchers given out and not enough like it was too much money dished out
